1552787641_15zJUjDdW3W9ppr6Voei1XHTyP8zr.body: probably get more information asking on 4/8chan

1552858206_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body: On your Tor and tracker points. I think Zeronet and i2p would be a great match. Vuze/BiglyBT work awesome over i2p using dht.

1552916412_1GDzVsFoYamHqWcYBcuvVWFCAt3Y5.body:
Tor was not designed to run with bittorrent. By using bittorent over Tor, you are hurting the Tor network.
While i2p is much better suited for p2p.
Tor provides one with better anonymous access to the open internet and I2P provides one with a more robust and reliable “network within the network,” a true darknet, if you will.
Since there is a stigma of running Java for people there could be a implementation of one of the c++ versions. Either i2pd or Kovri. 
Could possibly have it setup similar to BiglyBT where people can choose to either go full i2p connections only or be a hybrid with clearnet, Tor, i2p. 

Can read more comparisons here: https://geti2p.net/en/comparison/tor

Whats interesting is that Zeronet had two i2p devs that look like they were willing to help with the implementation in 2017/2018. https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/45
With both of these devs now working more on Zcash and LokiNet might be harder to get someone to work on it.

If http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/help_zeronet/donate/
On here if DHT support was changed to i2p support since it would also cover DHT we could probably rally up some donations to help pay for devs to help again.
